full_threads.body:
Hi Joshua,

Thanks for the update—great to hear WP File Download is working well for your setup!

Regarding your question about the search bar showing results from all categories: you're absolutely right that by default, the search engine pulls from the full file repository. However, WP File Download does allow you to narrow the scope of the search using their Search Engine Shortcode Generator, which gives you control over the categories being queried.

To make the search bar specific to each category (e.g., Banksia Care or First Access), you can generate a custom shortcode with the desired category preselected and locked. Here's how you can do it:

Steps to Create a Category-Locked Search Bar

  1. Log in to the backend of the site.
  2. Navigate to:
    WP File Download > Configuration
    or directly:
    https://www.breakthrucollege.edu.au/wp-admin/admin.php?page=wpfd-config
  3. Go to the Shortcodes section and use the Search Engine Shortcode Generator.
    Under the generator options:
    • Choose the category you want the search to apply to.
    • Disable the option for users to change categories (this "locks" it to the one you select).
  4. Generate the shortcode and place it at the top of the appropriate page.

Once you’ve done this, the search field on each page will only return results from its respective category.

Please note I've hidden this element for now, so you will need to login and view the page in the backend to look at the element I'm referring to

Joshua Cook

Marketing Manager, Disability Services

T 1800 767 212

Thanks Joel, I ended up implementing WP File Download and setup two pages:
https://www.breakthrucollege.edu.au/banksia-care/
https://www.breakthrucollege.edu.au/first-access/

Quick question if you can possibly help me:
At the top of both pages I added the search bar function, but I want this search to be distinct only to that category. Currently, when you search displays files from all categories. Though you have the option for the user to filter this, I want it to be locked (i.e. Using the search bar on the Banksia Care page only shows Banksia care page, First Access only shows First Access files). I can't easily see an option to adjust this - is this something you can look at for me please?

Regards,

Joshua Cook

Marketing Manager, Disability Services

Hi Joshua,

Thanks for the update — I completely understand the urgency, especially now that this is impacting students’ ability to complete assessments. I’ve moved this up the priority list and, to help you get started right away, I’ve compiled a shortlist of WordPress plugins that should suit your needs for setting up a hidden “intranet”-style page with document access.

Recommended Plugins:

1. WP File Download
A powerful file and folder manager that allows you to embed document sections directly into your Divi pages using shortcodes. It includes front-end access, search, and permission control — ideal for organizing policy/procedure documents for students.
2. FileBird – WordPress Media Library Folders
Simplifies backend media management by letting you organize files into folders. You can pair this with other Divi-compatible file viewer plugins or custom code modules to show content on the front end.
3. SP Project & Document Manager
Supports document sharing with role-based permissions and front-end file access. You can embed file lists using shortcodes into any Divi layout.
4. WP Document Revisions
Provides document version control and archiving. More backend-focused, but can be integrated with front-end visibility using Divi shortcodes or paired with access control plugins.
5. Members by MemberPress
Lets you restrict access to specific pages or content sections within your Divi-built site. Perfect for keeping the intranet page unlinked and accessible only to students.

Let me know if this setup aligns with your needs

Hi Joel,

Any chance I can get you to bump this up the priority list? I've just been informed this issue is now impacting our students ability to complete assessments, so we need to find a solution ideally by Friday. Even if you can just recommend some plugins for me to look at, I can have a go at installing and doing the setup myself. Let me know what's realistic.

Cheers,

Joshua Cook

Marketing Manager, Disability Services

T 1800 767 212

We’ll review everything in more detail and get back to you with an update early next week. If any questions come up in the meantime, we’ll be sure to reach out.

Appreciate your patience!

full_threads.body:
Hi guys,

I'm wanting your help with a niche website feature if possible please. As part of one of the units/courses in our Certificate III in Individual Support class, students must so a mock scenario where they visit a fake employers website, find relevant policies/procedure documents, and comment on which apply to specific scenarios. Previously, these documents were hosted with an external provider, however that person has now closed their business.

We are now wanting to move all of these documents to a hidden (unlinked) web page and store them on our own website. Additionally, so students can work with the files in the mock setting, we'd like to create a fake "intranet" page on our website where students can access these documents. There are approximately 15 folders/sections currently, each with 5 - 10 documents in each.

Is this something you're able to support, or have you come across this scenario and created a solution in the past? Even if it's a plugin or something we can purchase, that would be great.

Please let me know.

Regards,
Joshua Cook
Marketing Manager, Disability Services
T 1800 767 212
|
M 0490 305 252
|
E joshua.cook@breakthru.org.au
Level 2, 689 Ann Street Fortitude Valley Queensland 4006
